dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, have you seen the news about Tencent? It's, like, huge.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, have you seen the news about Tencent? It's, like, huge.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah, absolutely! Their Hong Kong listing, right? Um, potentially raising up to almost thirteen billion dollars.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah, absolutely! Their Hong Kong listing, right? Um, potentially raising up to almost thirteen billion dollars.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the worlds biggest IPO so far this year, Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba is set to raise up to $12.9 billion in a landmark public listing in Hong Kong...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Thirteen billion! And it's a lifeline for Hong Kong, too, with all the political unrest and, uh, recession they've been facing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Thirteen billion! And it's a lifeline for Hong Kong, too, with all the political unrest and, uh, recession they've been facing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Alibabas listing will help boost Hong Kongs financial markets, given that the city recently slid into recession for the first time in over a decade, following more than five months of anti-government protests.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. It's a secondary listing for them, actually. They first went public in Shanghai back in 2012, if I remember correctly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. It's a secondary listing for them, actually. They first went public in Shanghai back in twenty twelve, if I remember correctly.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The debut on the Hong Kong stock exchange is a secondary listing for Alibaba, which initially went public on the New York Stock Exchange in 2014, raising $25 billion in the worlds biggest IPO in history.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right, right. And they're pricing these shares at a discount, too, which is interesting.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, right. And they're pricing these shares at a discount, too, which is interesting.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Alibaba said that it would price shares at $HK176 ($22.50) each, a discount of 2.9% to its New York Stock Exchange closing price...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, about ten percent off their Shanghai price. It's, like, a pretty sweet deal for investors there, I guess.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, about ten percent off their Shanghai price. It's, like, a pretty sweet deal for investors there, I guess.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Alibaba said that it would price shares at $HK176 ($22.50) each, a discount of 2.9% to its New York Stock Exchange closing price...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It's wild how much cash this could add to their pile. Fifty billion dollars? That's double Alibaba!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's wild how much cash this could add to their pile. Fifty billion dollars? That's double Alibaba!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Scheduled for November 26, the listing could swell Alibabas cash pile to around $44 billion, which would be more than any other internet company and double that of rival e-commerce giant Tencent, according to Bloomberg.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Unbelievable. And it's already, like, the second-biggest IPO this year, ahead of Uber's debut, even. [overlaps] Which was huge.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Unbelievable. And it's already, like, the second-biggest I P O this year, ahead of Uber's debut, even. Which was huge.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It would also be the worlds biggest IPO so far in 2019: Alibabas Hong Kong listing exceeds Ubers $8.1 billion public debut in New York...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] Yeah, Uber was massive! But I guess it'll still get totally eclipsed by Saudi Aramco later this year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, Uber was massive! But I guess it'll still get totally eclipsed by Saudi Aramco later this year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Alibabas listing will likely be eclipsed by Saudi Arabias state oil giant Saudi Aramco, going public on the Riyadh stock exchange in December, with its IPO set to raise up to $25.6 billion...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, for sure, Aramco's in a league of its own. But this Tencent listing still does a lot for Hong Kong's financial markets.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, for sure, Aramco's in a league of its own. But this Tencent listing still does a lot for Hong Kong's financial markets.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Alibabas listing will help boost Hong Kongs financial markets, given that the city recently slid into recession for the first time in over a decade...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. And, um, it kinda signals that Chinese companies might be looking closer to home for listings now, given the trade war, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely. And, um, it kinda signals that Chinese companies might be looking closer to home for listings now, given the trade war, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: And with the ongoing U.S.-China trade war leading the Chinese government to call for companies to publicly list closer to home, Alibabas listing helps cement the Hong Kong Stock Exchange as one of this years largest venues for IPOs...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. It sets a precedent, I think, for other Chinese unicorns to choose Hong Kong over, you know, the US.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. It sets a precedent, I think, for other Chinese unicorns to choose Hong Kong over, you know, the U S.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...and that could set an example for other Chinese unicorns to opt for Hong Kong over the U.S. when they go public.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Speaking of China, did you catch the Singles Day numbers? Tencent just smashed records.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Speaking of China, did you catch the Singles Day numbers? Tencent just smashed records.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In its eleventh edition of Singles Day, the biggest shopping event in the world, Alibaba set a new sales record of $38.4 billion in gross merchandise volume during the 24-hour shopping bonanza.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, my gosh, thirty-eight point four billion dollars in gross merchandise volume! In just twenty-four hours!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, my gosh, thirty-eight point four billion dollars in gross merchandise volume! In just twenty-four hours!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In its eleventh edition of Singles Day, the biggest shopping event in the world, Alibaba set a new sales record of $38.4 billion in gross merchandise volume during the 24-hour shopping bonanza.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That's, like, more than double Black Friday, Cyber Monday, and Amazon Prime Day *combined*. Just insane.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's, like, more than double Black Friday, Cyber Monday, and Amazon Prime Day combined. Just insane.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: To compare, Singles Day far outpaces other big e-commerce days in the U.S., with Alibabas haul more than double the amount sold on last years Black Friday, Cyber Monday and Amazon Prime Day combined.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It really puts things into perspective, doesn't it? Just, uh, how massive that market is.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really puts things into perspective, doesn't it? Just, uh, how massive that market is.
